programs.name: SAJE (Strengthening Abilities and Journeys of Empowerment)
programs.what: Income support up to $1,250/mo, rent help, mental health, dental ($1,000/yr), optical ($600/2yr)

programs.name: SAJE Rent Supplement
programs.what: Up to $600/month for 24 months if you qualify

programs.name: Youth Educational Assistance Fund
programs.what: Up to $5,500 per year for school (max $11,000 total)

programs.name: SAJE Life-Skills Funding
programs.what: Up to $5,500/year (max $11,000) for education, training, life skills

programs.name: SAJE Housing Agreements
programs.what: Stay in your current home until 21 with support

programs.name: BC211
programs.what: Free help finding services: housing, food, counselling, more

programs.name: AgedOut.com
programs.what: Info on education, housing, jobs, life skills

programs.name: Ready, Set, Go Program
programs.what: $1,800/mo at 18, $1,500 at 19, $1,000 at 20–22. Extra $500/mo if in school. Work 40 hrs/wk without losing benefits.

programs.name: Aftercare Benefits Initiative (ABI)
programs.what: Free health and dental benefits for 4 years. Life skills counselling until 29.

programs.name: Living and Learning Grant (OSAP)
programs.what: Money for post-secondary. No repayment for former youth in care.

programs.name: Extended Care Support
programs.what: Some children's aid societies offer support until 25. Ask your worker.

programs.name: 211 Ontario
programs.what: Free help finding services: housing, food, counselling, more

programs.name: AgedOut.com
programs.what: Info on education, housing, jobs, life skills
